questionnaire.name: 2. theBIKEnet Context - Where and with what you move

sections.title: theBIKEnet Context Questionnaire
sections.description:
üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This second questionnaire focuses on your living and travel context: where you usually move, what vehicles you can access, and how easily you can park or store them. Understanding these daily conditions helps us identify barriers, needs, and opportunities for cycling and micromobility in different parts of the city.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Territorial Context
sections.description: Questions about the area you live in or travel through most often, and any local spots you find unsafe or uncomfortable.

questions.text: Which Municipio of Rome do you travel in most frequently? (You will be able to indicate other frequent areas next)
Which is the second Municipio you travel in most frequently?
Which is the third Municipio you travel in most frequently?
Which of the following situations do you consider unsafe for cycling or using e-scooters in your area, even if you do not use them yourself? (Select up to 3 options)

options.text: Poor road surface or obstacles (e.g. potholes, debris)
Poor visibility (e.g. blind spots, parked vehicles blocking the view)
Conflicts with parked cars (e.g. opening doors, sudden movements)

sections.title: Household and Personal Mobility Resources
sections.description: What transport options and vehicles are available in your household.

questions.text: How many bicycles/e-bikes are available in your household (including yours)?
How many e-scooters are available in your household (including yours)?
Which other vehicles are available in your household?
If a car or motorcycle/moped is available in your household, how easy is it for you to use it when you need it?
Do you currently hold a valid driving license that is valid in Italy?
Which of the following vehicles do you personally have regular access to for your trips?

sections.title: Parking
sections.description: Where and how you usually park or store your vehicles (car, bicycle, or e-scooter), and how easy or difficult it is.

questions.text: Do you have a private or reserved parking space for a car at your place of residence?

options.text: Yes, included in my residence (e.g. private or shared garage, reserved parking space)
Yes, but in a paid parking facility not included in my residence
No, I rely on street or public parking
I do not have access to a car

questions.text: Where do you usually store your bicycle or e-bike at your place of residence?

options.text: In a private or reserved bicycle parking space included in my residence (e.g. private or shared garage, bike room, cellar)
In a paid bicycle parking facility not included in my residence (e.g. bike box, private garage, secure bike parking)
Inside my apartment (no dedicated bike parking space)
In public bicycle parking spaces (e.g. bike racks)
In public spaces not specifically designed for bicycle parking (e.g., poles, railings)
I do not own or keep a bicycle or e-bike

questions.text: When you park or retrieve your bicycle or e-bike at your residence, how much physical effort does it usually require, considering the weight and handling of the vehicle you use most often?

options.text: No effort at all (easy ground-level access)
Some effort (short ramp, small step, or manual gate)
High effort (need to lift or carry the bike frequently)
I do not park a bicycle or e-bike at home

questions.text: Is there any formal or designated parking available at your workplace or study location?

options.text: Yes, parking specifically for bicycles or e-scooters
Yes, parking for both bicycles/e-scooters and cars
No, there is no parking available
I do not work or study outside home

üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This second questionnaire focuses on your living and travel context: where you usually move, what vehicles you can access, and how easily you can park or store them. Understanding these daily conditions helps us identify barriers, needs, and opportunities for cycling and micromobility in different parts of the city.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about theBIKEnet project

it.#2. theBIKEnet Context - Where and with: 2. theBIKEnet ‚Äì Contesto ¬∑ Dove e con cosa ti muovi
it.#üö≤ <b>theBIKEnet</b> is a public rese:
üö≤ theBIKEnet √® un progetto di ricerca pubblica che studia come le persone si muovono nelle citt√†, unendo scienza, tecnologia ed esperienza quotidiana. Il nostro obiettivo √® rendere la mobilit√† urbana pi√π sicura, equa e sostenibile per tutte le persone.

Questo secondo questionario si concentra sul tuo contesto di vita e di spostamento: dove ti muovi abitualmente, a quali veicoli hai accesso e quanto √® facile parcheggiarli o custodirli. Comprendere queste condizioni quotidiane ci aiuta a individuare barriere, bisogni e opportunit√† per la mobilit√† ciclistica e la micromobilit√† in diverse aree della citt√†.

La partecipazione √® completamente volontaria e anonima. Le informazioni fornite saranno utilizzate esclusivamente a fini scientifici ed educativi.

Scopri di pi√π sul progetto theBIKEnet
it.#Questions about the area you live in or: Domande sulle aree che frequenti pi√π spesso e su eventuali situazioni o luoghi che percepisci come insicuri o scomodi.
it.#Which Municipio of Rome do you travel i: In quale Municipio di Roma ti sposti pi√π spesso? (Potrai indicare altre aree frequentate nelle domande successive)
it.#Which is the second Municipio you trave: Qual √® il secondo Municipio in cui ti sposti pi√π spesso?
it.#Which is the third Municipio you travel: Qual √® il terzo Municipio in cui ti sposti pi√π spesso?
it.#Which of the following situations do yo: Quali delle seguenti situazioni consideri insicure quando vai in bicicletta o usi un monopattino elettrico nella tua zona, anche se non li utilizzi personalmente? (Seleziona fino a 3 opzioni)
it.#Poor road surface or obstacles (e.g. po: Fondo stradale in cattive condizioni o ostacoli (es. buche, detriti)
it.#Poor visibility (e.g. blind spots, park: Scarsa visibilit√† (es. angoli ciechi, veicoli in sosta che ostacolano la visuale)
it.#Conflicts with parked cars (e.g. openin: Conflitti con veicoli in sosta (es. apertura delle portiere, movimenti improvvisi)
it.#Conflicts with other micromobility user: Conflitti con altre persone che utilizzano mezzi di micromobilit√†
it.#Household and Personal Mobility Resourc: Risorse di mobilit√† personali e del nucleo familiare
it.#What transport options and vehicles are: Quali opzioni di trasporto e veicoli sono disponibili nel tuo nucleo familiare.
it.#How many bicycles/e-bikes are available: Quante biciclette/e-bike sono disponibili nel tuo nucleo familiare (inclusa la tua)?
it.#How many e-scooters are available in yo: Quanti monopattini elettrici sono disponibili nel tuo nucleo familiare (incluso il tuo)?
it.#Which other vehicles are available in y: Quali altri veicoli sono disponibili nel tuo nucleo familiare?
it.#If a car or motorcycle/moped is availab: Quando nel tuo nucleo familiare √® disponibile un‚Äôauto o una moto, quanto ti √® facile utilizzarla quando ne hai bisogno?
it.#Sometimes difficult (shared or limited): A volte difficile (condiviso o con disponibilit√† limitata)
it.#Do you currently hold a valid driving l: Hai una patente di guida valida in Italia?
it.#Which of the following vehicles do you: A quali dei seguenti veicoli hai accesso regolare per i tuoi spostamenti?
it.#Where and how you usually park or store: Dove e come parcheggi o custodisci i tuoi veicoli (auto, bicicletta o monopattino elettrico) e quanto √® facile o difficile farlo.
it.#Do you have a private or reserved parki: Hai un parcheggio privato o riservato per l‚Äôauto presso la tua abitazione?
it.#Yes, included in my residence (e.g. pri: S√¨, incluso presso la mia abitazione (es. garage privato o condominiale, posto riservato)
it.#Yes, but in a paid parking facility not: S√¨, ma in una struttura a pagamento non inclusa nella mia abitazione
it.#No, I rely on street or public parking: No, mi affido al parcheggio su strada o in spazi pubblici
it.#Where do you usually store your bicycle: Dove custodisci di solito la tua bicicletta o e-bike presso la tua abitazione?
it.#In a private or reserved bicycle parkin: In uno spazio privato o riservato incluso nella mia abitazione (es. garage privato o condominiale, locale bici, cantina)
it.#In a paid bicycle parking facility not: In una struttura a pagamento non inclusa nella mia abitazione (es. bike box, garage privato, parcheggio sicuro)
it.#In public spaces not specifically desig: In spazi pubblici non dedicati (es. pali, ringhiere)
it.#I do not own or keep a bicycle or e-bik: Non possiedo n√© custodisco una bicicletta o e-bike
it.#When you park or retrieve your bicycle: Quando parcheggi o riprendi la tua bicicletta o e-bike a casa, quanto sforzo fisico richiede di solito, considerando peso e maneggevolezza del mezzo che usi pi√π spesso?
it.#No effort at all (easy ground-level acc: Nessuno sforzo (accesso facile a livello strada)
it.#Some effort (short ramp, small step, or: Poco sforzo (piccola rampa, gradino o cancello manuale)
it.#High effort (need to lift or carry the: Sforzo elevato (serve sollevare o trasportare spesso la bici)
it.#I do not park a bicycle or e-bike at ho: Non parcheggio una bicicletta o e-bike a casa
it.#Is there any formal or designated parki: √à disponibile un parcheggio formale o designato nel tuo luogo di lavoro o di studio?
it.#Yes, parking specifically for bicycles: S√¨, parcheggio specifico per biciclette o monopattini elettrici
it.#Yes, parking for both bicycles/e-scoote: S√¨, parcheggio sia per biciclette/monopattini sia per auto
it.#I do not work or study outside home: Non lavoro n√© studio fuori casa
